Within this sketch, create the following: Face 1 For Face 1, create Loop 1, which is closed and consists of 4 lines, as follows: * Line 1: Starting at point [0.0, 0.0] and ending at point [0.5625, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting at point [0.5625, 0.0] and ending at point [0.5625, 0.75] * Line 3: Starting at point [0.5625, 0.75] and ending at point [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Starting at point [0.0, 0.75] and ending at point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the Sketch into 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by applying the following rotation and translation parameters. * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] (taken from the coordinate system) * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0469, 0.0] (taken from the coordinate system) Extrude the Sketch Extrude the 3Dmodel by the depth of 0.0469 in the positive Z direction, maintaining the shape and orientation defined by Face 1. Part 1 Dimensions The resulting part, Part 1, would have the following dimensions: * Length: 0.5625 (along the X-axis) * Width: 0.0469 (along the Y-axis) * Height: 0.75 (along the Z-axis) Final Shape Instructions Create the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with no translation or rotation adjustments for ease of the following instructions. Draw the Sketch for the Base Create a new 2D sketch in XY plane of the new coordinate system. Within this sketch, create a new rectangle using lines. Set the rectangle with the following dimensions: * Length: The length of Part 1 plus the extrusion depth of Part 1; 0.5625 + 0.0469 = 0.6094 * Width: The width of Part 1; 0.0469 Draw the Sketch for the Height Create a new line, Line 5, that starts at the origin ([0.0, 0.0]) and is parallel to the Z axis. Draw another line, Line 6, with a length equal to the height specified in the assembly JSON (half the length of the sides) starting at the endpoint of Line 5. These lines will be utilized for the height of the final shape. Sketch Scaling Do not include the scaling step for the final shape, as the dimensions have been directly implemented to the sketch. Transform the Sketch into 3D Combine the sketches of the Base and Height into a 3D model along the Z-axis, resulting in a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, parallel and perpendicular sides, and equal side lengths. The final shape will use the dimensions provided in the assembly JSON. Height: 0.375 (the length obtained in the final shape) Width: 0.0469 (the width obtained in the final shape) Length: 0.6094 (the length obtained in the final shape)</description>

Here are the details of the sketch: **Face 1** This face contains two loops, each defined by a circle. - Loop 1: - Circle 1: - Center: (0.25, 0.25) - Radius: 0.25 - Loop 2: - Circle 1: - Center: (0.25, 0.25) - Radius: 0.2218 **Face 2** This face contains one loop, defined by several lines and an arc. - Loop 1: - Line 1: - Start Point: (0.25, 0.0) - End Point: (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: - Start Point: (0.75, 0.0) - End Point: (0.75, 0.5) - Line 3: - Start Point: (0.75, 0.5) - End Point: (0.25, 0.5) - Arc 1: - Start Point: (0.25, 0.5) - Mid Point: (0.5, 0.25) - End Point: (0.25, 0.0) **Step 3: Transform the Sketch into a 3D Sketch** Scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) **Step 4: Extrude the Sketch to Generate the 3D Model** Extrude the sketch along the normal direction to produce a solid body. The extrusion depth towards the normal should be 0.125 units, while the extrusion depth opposite the normal should be 0 units. The resulting shape is a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, resembling a ring or a washer. It has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.125 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.75 units</description>
